main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were observed in different locations, with reported sightings from various individuals including civilians, air force personnel, and radar operators. The objects were described as hovering, maneuvering at low altitudes, and exhibiting unusual characteristics such as ascending vertically at high speeds and sudden disappearances.
interesting points: The sighting reports include observations of an object with a bright bluish-white light hovering in a field, ascending vertically at a high rate of speed, and then disappearing from sight.
Radar operators at GATP tracked an unknown target at an altitude of 51,000 feet, traveling at a speed of 500 knots, with the motion of the object being smooth and continuous.
A senior alert operator observed a bright light moving across the sky at a high rate of speed and described it as having an unusual shape and not blinking like normal aircraft lights.
The witnesses of the sightings include responsible, mature sources, such as farmers, air force personnel, and radar operators.
The report also includes information about the weather conditions, sky visibility, and the last seen location of the objects.
location: various locations including Montanta, Pennsylvania, Ohio, and South Central Pennsylvania
witnesses: civilian observers, air force personnel, radar operators
photographs: no photographs available in the report
